The rotational inertia of the solid and hollow cylinder about their centers is given by <math alttext="I sub S equals one half m sub 0, end sub, r sub 0, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and <math alttext="I sub H equals m sub 0, end sub, r sub 0, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>H</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, respectively.
